metadata.name: fxhash x thi.ng project template #464
metadata.description:
THIS IS NOT AN ARTWORK (at least not intentional)!

This NFT acts as a donation/funding mechanism for a new project template Git repo, providing a compact, ready-to-go scaffolding for generative art projects aimed at the fx(hash) platform/marketplace.

https://github.com/thi-ng/fxhash-tpl

This template evolved over time and has served as basis for some of the author's own NFT projects (https://www.fxhash.xyz/u/toxi). The template is aimed at TypeScript (but can be easily adapted to plain JavaScript) and, at the time of writing, uses Vite as dev & build tool, ensuring an altogether great & speedy workflow with minimal fuzz.

(In the future, I'm aiming to provide an alternative version for more advanced hybrid projects using TypeScript, Zig (https://ziglang.org) and WebAssembly (https://webassembly.org/)...)

Framework agnostic

Even though several packages from the https://thi.ng/umbrella ecosystem are used to provide various essential overarching functionality, the template is organized in such a way that the main parts are completely framework-agnostic. You should be able to easily plug in your own toolkit of choice, however I cannot promise to provide support for this myself (though happy to accept PRs, also in terms of further docs, how-tos, guides etc.)

Example project

A tiny, fully documented throwaway example sketch is included, illustrating the following:

- Overall project structure & build commands
- FXhash related setup
- Static & dynamic configuration and state (re)initialization (via dependency graph)
- FXhash PRNG wrapper & utilities
- Canvas & SVG conversion/export/download
- 2D geometry creation, transformation & drawing
- Basic vector algebra example usage


Keyboard shortcuts

- space :  pause/play animation
- x : download canvas as PNG
- s : download SVG version

In case of doubt, it's this example project what is used here for minting. The funding, however, will be used for the further maintenance of both this project template and supporting my other open source work. 20% are also donated to the FXhash development team itself.

Thank you for your support! ðŸ™ðŸ˜

metadata.name: GuilCity #108
metadata.description:
GuilCity is the beginning of an exciting journey bringing Guillaume Cornetâ€™s densely-packed cities into the generative realm with the help of Matthewâ€™s (@frostbittenâ€™s) magic touch.

Matthewâ€”with his background in coding and animationâ€”enables a new opportunity to experience these cities like never before. Numerous elements from vehicles to characters and even architecture have been given life. Interact with the city (computer mouse only): poke and peek around (even behind) in this active search & find journey! 

Each generative city fills the composition with the type of whimsical, expressive elements and characters youâ€™ve come to know Guil for. What kinds of wacky features have you discovered yet?

â€”

The tech behind this project utilizes the highly compressed WEBP image format in order to provide so many full-color options. This format is great, but unfortunately Safari on desktop/laptop must be upgraded to at least version 14 and macOS to at least version 11 Big Sur to use it.

The animation system for this project was created from scratch with additional help from the PIXI.js library for individual mesh animations.

â€”

To find out more about your GuilCity, copy your unique operation hash and place it at the end of the following url:
â€¢ https://my.guil.city?fxhash=
(for example: https://my.guil.city?fxhash=ooezL8cffNJGSc4TfNQp3u3WnDpkg8J3zFRczLuumceoYU5QYPs)

â€”


The entire process has been a learning experience for both of us, adapting and exploring the many possibilities to interact with each othersâ€™ skills and ideas.

We really enjoyed building this project together and are excited as we invite you to take a dive into your very own urban playground!

Merci Ã  tous! Cheers!
  - Guillaume Cornet, Matthew Seremet

metadata.name: Paper Art 3D #112
metadata.description:
Welcome to â€œPaper Art 3Dâ€

â€œPaper Art 3Dâ€ is the beginning of my journey as a new generative art creator. Starting from simple geometrical shapes like a small step towards to something greater in the future. 
It all began from simple 3D shapes that combined into mountains, trees, and houses. Then everything expanded and united into many exotic cityscapes. Each with their own style and uniqueness.

Built with three.js.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Space Bar  --> Save a simple screenshot image of the canvas
Mouse: Drag & Scroll  --> Rotate & Zoom in-out 
- - - - - - - - - - - - - -

metadata.name: Lazy Kitties #405
metadata.description:
Welcome to the Lazy Kitties Society!

Be the guardian of these cute kitties born in the Tezos blockchain space.
And please be a part of our Lazy Kitties Society!
https://discord.gg/lazykitties

Let's create a wonderful world with kittens! MEOW!

[Mouse Movement]: Eye Control
[Press 'c' or 'C'] : Kitten's Favorite Cushion (Toggle)
[Press 's' or 'S'] : Save Snapshot (With BG)
[Press 't' or 'T'] : Save Snapshot (Transparent BG)
[Click] : ??

Made with Love & P5.js !
NFT License 2.0
By CSLIM, 2022

metadata.name: Plottable Thousands #79
metadata.description:
'Thousands' explores the packing of recursive circles and golden angle spirals distributing various particles on a A4 canvas.

A SVG file can be exported (right click save) to plot the piece physically.

You can enjoy the digital version that simulate ink effects and optional, thanks to the utility token decoupling, get a physical one: the digital NFT is the recipe to a plottable art piece, owning it confers the right to plot or request a physical plot from @greweb (https://greweb.me/plots/nft). @greweb would use fountain pens but other plotting artists are free to achieve it with their own materials and ship to collectors â€“ as long as NFT is owned at request time.

Code: https://github.com/gre/gre/tree/master/doodles/plottable-thousands

@greweb â€“ 2022 â€“ tech: WebGL + Rust + WASM â€“ CC BY-SA 4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/

metadata.name: CitÃ©s nuageuses #173
metadata.description:
Un de mes frÃ¨res sâ€™est envolÃ© hier. Ou avant-hier, je ne sais plus. Il a vendu du lest pour sortir une fille. Une bourrasque soudaine les a emportÃ©s, lui et ses deux tickets de cinÃ©ma.

Cela fait bien trois semaines que nous nâ€™avons pas eu de livraison. Pas de courrier non plus, par la mÃªme occasion. Jâ€™en reÃ§ois rarement. Je nâ€™ai jamais reÃ§u quâ€™une lettre, en rÃ©alitÃ©. Câ€™Ã©tait une longue lettre Ã©pistolaire de mon ami Dino. Il est cowboy, dans une citÃ© voisine. 

Mon frÃ¨re connaissait cette fille depuis bien cinq ou six ans. Il Ã©taient au collÃ¨ge ensemble. Il y avait encore des livraisons toutes les semaines, Ã  cette Ã©poque. Parfois deux fois par semaine. On pouvait vendre des enclumes et acheter du petit lest. Poids pour poids, on y perdait. Mais avec Ã§a on arrivait quand mÃªme Ã  vivre.

Câ€™Ã©tait le temps oÃ¹ les rochers nâ€™Ã©taient pas attachÃ©s. Ils dÃ©rivaient rarement, le vent nâ€™Ã©tait pas si fort. Et ils Ã©taient plus denses aussi. Aujourdâ€™hui, un rocher qui nâ€™est pas en laisse ne sera plus lÃ  demain.

Ã€ lâ€™Ã©poque, jâ€™Ã©tais moi-mÃªme cowboy. Je vivais avec Jacques, un bon copain. Il nâ€™y avait rien de sexuel entre nous. On gardait les rochers. Un soir, on jouait Ã  lâ€™espagnolette, il mâ€™a relancÃ© de trois alors que jâ€™Ã©tais atout trÃ¨fle. Vous imaginez la suite. Je ne lâ€™ai plus jamais revu aprÃ¨s Ã§a.

Plus personne ne va au collÃ¨ge. Mon frÃ¨re Ã©tait dâ€™une des derniÃ¨res gÃ©nÃ©rations. AprÃ¨s Ã§a les gens ne voyaient plus lâ€™intÃ©rÃªt. Tout devient de plus en plus lÃ©ger, et apprendre Ã  lire ou Ã©crire ne pÃ¨se rien. Plus on mine, plus on vends des enclumes, plus on peut acheter du lest. Mais comme le lest est plus cher que les enclumes, Ã  force, la citÃ© devient de moins en moins lourde.

Le vent est de plus en plus fort aussi. Je pense que câ€™est pour Ã§a quâ€™il y a moins de livraisons. Il y a de moins en moins de citÃ©s qui arrivent Ã  rester suspendues. Celle de Dino sâ€™est envolÃ©e lâ€™annÃ©e derniÃ¨re, Dino avec. Avec moins de citÃ©s Ã  visiter par voyage, les livraisons sont moins rentables.

Avant dâ€™Ãªtre cowboy je construisais des ponts. Câ€™est comme Ã§a que jâ€™ai appris Ã  lier les rochers. Plus personne ne le fait aujourdâ€™hui. Il faut commencer par ancrer le rocher domestique. Et aprÃ¨s, il faut attendre. Câ€™est la partie la plus difficile. Personne nâ€™a appris Ã  suffisamment attendre. Parce que plus le temps passe, plus on devient lÃ©gers. Mais câ€™est le plus important. Il faut attendre le que rocher sauvage devienne suffisamment lÃ©ger. Sinon, il emportera le rocher domestique avec lui et on aura tout perdu.

Je me demande pourquoi il a achetÃ© ces deux tickets de cinÃ©ma. Câ€™est toujours le mÃªme film qui passe. Je ne lâ€™ai jamais vu. Ã‡a parle de dialectique et de maÃ§onnerie, il paraÃ®t. Le cinÃ©ma câ€™est un domaine que je trouve trop contraignant. Encore une idÃ©e de bureaucrate. Places assignÃ©es. Horaires fixes. Un processus administratif au profit de la structure sociale. Classique. Les bureaucrates commencent toujours par nous exploiter et ils finissent par nous aliÃ©ner. â€œServir le peupleâ€, ils appellent Ã§a. 

Cela fait des annÃ©es que le pont est de moins en moins solide. De toutes les faÃ§ons, on nâ€™a rien pour le rÃ©parer. Nos rochers sont domestiquÃ©s depuis le temps, mais ils sâ€™entrainent les uns les autres au lieu de se stabiliser. La suspension des citÃ©s, Ã§a a lâ€™air simple mais Ã§a ne lâ€™est pas vraiment. Quand elles ont Ã©tÃ© construites, avec les machines-outils des livreurs, elles Ã©taient bien suspendues. Mais peu Ã  peu, elles se sont dÃ©gradÃ©es. La seule richesse des citÃ©s, câ€™est leur gravitÃ©. Pourquoi rÃ©parer ce qui est destinÃ© Ã  sâ€™envoler ?

Je comprends pourquoi mon frÃ¨re a vendu du lest. AprÃ¨s tout, le lest est lÃ  pour Ãªtre vendu tant quâ€™il vaut encore quelque chose. Jeudi dernier, le pont est tombÃ©. Notre deuxiÃ¨me rocher majeur est toujours reliÃ© par la chaine des rochers mineurs, mais elle ne va pas tenir longtemps. La citÃ© va sâ€™envoler bientÃ´t. Peut-Ãªtre demain ou aprÃ¨s-demain. Je vous laisse, je dois aller miner.
